Message.Title: Mason forced Yahoo to terminate its message boards. My lifes work is lost!
Message.Msg: I spent my life creating thousands of aliase IDs and mimic aliase IDs to spread my thinly disguised KKK agenda only to have Mason force Yahoo to terminate it all! I'll have to go back to my roots of scribbling on public restroom walls with my own c*r*a*p* "... Yahoo also said that on April 1 it will stop supporting Yahoo Avatars - the cartoon-like digital characters that consumers create to depict them on Web services such as Yahoo instant messenger and Facebook. Consumers who want to continue using their avatar on Yahoo's online services must download the avatar and then re-upload the information to their personalized Yahoo profile. The other Yahoo products set to be terminated include Yahoo App Search, Yahoo Sports IQ, Yahoo Clues, the Yahoo Message Boards website and the Yahoo Updates API. (Reporting By Alexei Oreskovic. Editing by Andre Grenon)

Message.Title: US Budget cuts
Message.Msg: In my opinion, the US budget cut issue is a big problem and a pretty worrying. The unresolved issue might cause the US Government to shut down. Uncertainty is one of the scariest thing can drive all the investor away. See what happen to Greece and also Italy (Recently). The share price drop drastically because of the uncertainties. OK, lets say if the sequester by the Congress comes into effect, this can cause spending cuts to many sectors. We all are aware the effect of the spending cuts which is currently happen in Europe recently, especially the country like Spain and Greece. It has caused massive unemployment in these countries. Spending cuts - People will have less money to spend - Businesses will receive less business and reduce workforces - Unemployment will go up I am afraid there might be a sell of soon in the market. Any opinion?

Message.Title: I guess democraps cut their budget by not paying their power bill, yet the MSM says NOTHING
Message.Msg: The Democratic National Committee has no intention of repaying the country’s largest electrical power company for the unprecedented $10 million line of credit it guaranteed to help a local host committee fund last September’s Democratic National Convention in Charlotte, N.C. According to an article on the Washington Times web site, an official for Duke Energy said the company would claim the money as a business expense for tax purposes, meaning shareholders will foot $6 million of the cost. The amount of the loan and the secrecy surrounding it has raised red flags for government watchdog groups. They claim the arrangement smacks of serious conflict-of-interest issues for President Obama and disputes his claim to be committed to disclosure and transparency.

Message.Msg: An excellent reason to keep "beating up" BAC is that taxpayers continue to prop up this company, along with the other large financials, to the tune of $85 Billion a month with no end in sight. Even if BAC's share of this taxpayer largesse is only a billion or two a month, forcing them to 'trickle-down" some of the windfall to those directly impacted by the company's criminal behavior doesn't strike me as particularly draconian prosecutorial over-reach. While you're tilting at windmills with frivolous lawsuits against the government, though, maybe you should slap a few on Ben and the Federal Reserve. Destroying BAC is easy: just turn off the free-money pump that keeps them afloat.

Message.Title: Analysis and Review the following week, B of A may finally get permission to boost its payout
Message.Msg: Bank of America Corp (NYSE:BAC) , 0.4% dividend yield Ever since the financial crisis, Bank of America Corp has paid as little as possible to its shareholders in dividends: a single penny per share each quarter. But B of A hasn't had control of its dividend destiny. In 2011, the Federal Reserve submitted a request to the Federal Reserve to raise its dividend, but the Fed denied it. Now, though, the bank has come a long way, making strategic divestitures of assets to raise capital and build a healthier balance sheet. With stress test results due out this Thursday and the Fed's Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review the following week, B of A may finally get permission to boost its payout and get out of the Dow's dividend basement.

Message.Msg: There was no whining except from you. Did you read the original post? Mr Obama has claimed that the cuts could cost 750,000 jobs and slow already anaemic US economic growth by 0.5 per cent. But those figures are dismissed as alarmist scare tactics by the CBO, who are scornful that the federal government cannot absorb cuts that amount to just 2.4 per cent of the $3.55 trillion federal budget. "The president is ready to make it bite as hard as possible - all to send a simple message to the public: 'You want to control Washington spending, America? Fine, let me show you how much I can make it hurt'," said Mitch McConnell, minority Republican leader in the Senate. Like I said, you really are a schmuck, eh? LMFAO Later... SW
